Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that there is no evidence to support the statement that one of the San Bernardino shooters openly supported jihad online.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient evidence to support the assertion that one of the San Bernardino shooters openly supported jihad online.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that one of the San Bernardino shooters openly supported jihad online without providing substantial evidence.
Exist alternative explanation: There may be alternative explanations for the actions or motives of the San Bernardino shooters, which are not considered in the claim.
Understate: The claim may understate the complexity of the situation and the factors contributing to the San Bernardino shooting incident.
Exaggerate: There is no evidence of exaggeration in the claim.
Falters at times: The claim may falter in providing accurate and reliable information about the San Bernardino shooters' support for jihad online.
